Stay in a brand-new building in a neighborhood with character at Goodge Street. This modern vacation rental is in the heart of Fitzrovia, a central area of London that was once known for its boho past and today is a lively mix of cafés, offices and residential streets. Make this two-bedroom apartment your home for a getaway with friends, a holiday with family or a honeymoon in one of the world’s great cities.

The villa’s state-of-the-art amenities range from a TV, DVD player, sound system and Wi-Fi to an espresso machine, heating, air conditioning and laundry facilities. In warmer weather, relax with a glass of wine on the apartment’s spacious private terrace; when it’s cold outside, cozy up indoors by the fireplace.

A fold-away glass wall links the terrace with the open-concept living and dining room, flooding the interiors with sunlight and allowing you to create one large space during the summer. A sleek wall of built-in cabinets conceals the TV and fireplace, while pieces like brass-toned accent tables add a touch of glam. The galley kitchen is just through a doorway beyond the dining table and is fully equipped.

Each of the two bedrooms at Goodge Street has a double bed; one has an en-suite bathroom and the other has access to a shared bathroom. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms are spacious and bright, and one even offers terrace access.

From this luxury property’s location near the intersection of Goodge Street and Tottenham Court Road, it’s a 15-minute drive or less to attractions such as St. Paul’s Cathedral, Hyde Park, Kensington Palace, Trafalgar Square and Covent Garden. For shopping, dining and nightlife, you’ll find everything from chic bistros to old-fashioned pubs close at hand in Fitzrovia.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

Stay amid the icons of London in your own private pied-à-terre at Mayfair One. Tucked behind the famed Claridge’s hotel and restaurant, this jewel-like vacation rental is an oasis within easy reach of everything from shops and eateries to palaces and museums. This one-bedroom luxury property is just the right size for a couple wanting a getaway or a honeymoon in the heart of the city.

Mayfair One has all the comforts of home: a TV to entertain you after a day of sightseeing, heating and air conditioning for whatever the London weather does, laundry facilities to make it easy to get ready for another day out or a special evening, and Wi-Fi to keep you in touch with friends and family at home.

Taking its inspiration from both mid-century and modern style, the apartment is a study in understated glamour. The neutral tones of its open-concept living and dining room are set off by accents in jewel-toned fabrics and metallic artwork, as well as a geometric-patterned area rug. The separate kitchen is fully equipped and features stylishly high-contrast white cabinets against dark countertops.

The bedroom at Mayfair One has a king bed, TV and en-suite bathroom. Its chic silver-toned carpet matches the floor-length drapes, and a tufted headboard echoes the built-in storage. In the bathroom, polished stone tile lends spa-worthy appeal.

As this is the middle of London, there’s something nearby to make everyone’s holiday. The villa is surrounded by shops where you’ll find everything from vintage to couture and restaurants where you can have a quick coffee or a dinner to remember. It’s less than a 15-minute walk to Hyde Park and Piccadilly Circus, and less than a 20-minute drive to Trafalgar Square, Kensington Palace and Buckingham Palace, plus Westminster Abbey and Big Ben.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Villa dell'Angelo is a restored 18th-century Tuscan villa on the western slope of Mount Albano, with an expansive saline pool and antique-filled interior that make it the ideal accommodation for a family or group of up to eight people.

Cradled among spectacular views of the mountains, Villa Angelo is an exceptional 4-bedroom stone villa that embodies genuine Tuscan flavor. Villa dell'Angelo presents a picturesque location for a family gathering or special occasion, and is outfitted with the modern comforts you require for a relaxing holiday.

This villa is centered on 18 acres of woods and olive groves. The living areas have been decorated with antique furniture (some pieces dating back as far as the 16th century), paintings, doors, prints and Persian carpets for an authentic atmosphere. Sink into plush damask sofas in the living room, which is dominated by a large carved stone decorative fireplace, and topped by a coffered ceiling. The large antique dining table is the ideal place to gather for a special Italian meal with family or friends. Cozy up to the kitchen’s fireplace and savor a true-to-life, historic Italian kitchen that is nonetheless fully equipped.

After a wonderful meal, drift off to sleep under the soaring ceilings of the bedrooms. The bathrooms are updated with modern conveniences, such as rainhead showers and jetted tubs. Outdoors, the lawn is kept manicured and several outdoor seating areas create inviting spaces to enjoy a glass of wine among the olive and cypress trees. The saline pool features a large hydromassage area, terrace and changing area.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
What lies beneath this 16th-century brick villa is a hidden indulgence: a private spa with a secret pool. There are more obvious charms, too: two wings overlooking the Tuscan countryside, a magazine-worthy mix of ancient architecture and up-to-the-minute furnishings, and a location in the heart of hilltop San Miniato. It’s a 5-minute walk to restaurants and shops beneath the town’s clock tower.

Finish a day of sightseeing with a glass of wine, sipped on the furnished terrace overlooking the valley, or an espresso from the villa’s machine, savored while browsing via Wi-Fi. But the highlight of the villa’s amenities might be the Roman-bath-inspired spa reached by hidden staircase, where warm water and in-pool seating invite you to stay and soak a while.

Floor-to-ceiling glass bathes the warm red-brick walls of this vacation rental in light for a look that’s both industrial and inviting. The design is, like much of modern Italy, cool but not cold, with a cluster of sofas in the living room, mid-century walnut dining chairs in the dining area, and a marble breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen.

Each of the 2 bedrooms at this luxury property has a king bed, ensuite bathroom, and air conditioning; one of the bedrooms also has direct access to the indoor pool area. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms pair textured brick walls with sleek glass ones, and invite you to sit on mid-century-inspired armchairs.

Once part of a bustling palace, this villa is still at the heart of the action, close to restaurants where you can relive your honeymoon over a bottle of local wine and markets where you can pick up produce for a family dinner. It’s also a wonderful base for day trips during your holiday, with Florence, Lucca, and Pisa 30 minutes away, and Siena 40 minutes away by car.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
If you’re looking to immerse yourself in the vibrant culture, beautiful architecture, and ancient history of Florence, look no further. This downtown apartment is located right in the heart of Florence’s historical center, with its balcony overlooking one of the city’s major piazzas. Recently renovated, Capital features a delightful mix of luxurious modern amenities, and authentic Old-World design, with many of its ancient features still intact. Just step outside your front door, and you’ll be on the winding stone streets of Florence, with many of the city’s most famous monuments minutes away.

From the parquet floors to the fresco ceilings, Capital is designed with authentic elegance, grace, and the Old World ambiance of Florence. No expense was spared when decorating Capital’s dining areas, living room, state of the art kitchen, and four en-suite bedrooms. Throughout the villa, you’ll find the finest designer furniture, high-end electronics, and lavish fixtures. And, you’ll love people watching from the balcony’s exciting city view.

Capital’s fully equipped kitchen comes with a dishwasher, ice maker, and a Nespresso machine, as well as everything else you’ll need to prepare amazing meals. The formal dining area seats twelve, and there’s a small alfresco set on the balcony that is the perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee. The villa is also outfitted with Wi-Fi, television, and a stereo system. And, it comes with daily housekeeping during your stay.

From Capital’s convenient location, you’ll have no trouble finding your way to attractions like Ponte Vecchio, Piazza del Duomo, and Riccardi Medici Palace. At the Galleria dell Accademia you can visit Michelangelo’s masterpiece sculpture, David. If you’re in the mood for fine Italian cuisine, the Michelin-starred Borgo San Jacopo, located along the Arno River, is one of the country’s finest restaurants. And, if you’d like to see where the locals spend their nights out, cross the river to Piazza Santo Spirito, which is home to a proper Tuscan street market, and plenty of bars, restaurants, and cafes.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
From mountain views and lavish outdoor spaces to modern design, Villa Larino has everything you need for a Tuscan vacation in style. Located in the hills just east of Pisa, the four-bedroom villa puts the Tuscan landscape just outside your windows, and the region’s towns and cities within easy driving distance.

Take advantage of Villa Larino’s sun-soaked hilltop location in one of its outdoor spaces: a saltwater pool, pool deck filled with chaise longues, shower, grill, wood-burning oven, pergola or dining area. You can even breathe some fresh air into your workout routine at the small covered outdoor gym. Inside, there are video games and an iPod dock for entertainment, Wi-Fi access for convenience and air conditioning for comfort.

The villa’s decor juxtaposes traditional elements like brick hearths, beamed ceilings and terracotta floors with modern furnishings—think sleek cream leather sofas and cool Lucite chairs in the living room. The dining room pairs a hefty wooden Parsons-style table with Louis Ghost chairs for an effect that’s both rustic and chic. In the fully equipped modern kitchen, minimalist white cabinets support a graphic black breakfast bar.

Each of the property’s four bedrooms has air conditioning, a television and views of both the garden and mountains. Whimsical details like looped metal headboards and filigreed Lucite lamps and nightstands make each room a stylish retreat. All four bedrooms have double beds, and one has an en-suite bathroom as well.

Villa Larino is less than a mile from the nearest restaurant, in Alica, and about 4 km from the grocery store in Forcoli. You’ll find a gym in Peccioli, 5 km away, a restaurant in Palaia, about 6 km away, and a tennis club in Pontedera, about 9 km away. The town center and train station of Pontedera are 12 km away, the Castelfalfi golf club is 18 km away and the Pisa airport is just over 33 km away. Hit the slopes at Abetone, 110 km away, or the beach in Tirrenia, 42 km away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Clinging to the rocks of the Amalfi Coast, this seventeenth-century cliffside home is situated for incredible Ocean views, with many unique vantage points throughout its spacious grounds. With five luxurious bedrooms and plenty of indoor/outdoor shared spaces, Pamina is a great place to throw a family reunion or special event, like a destination wedding. Imagine the pictures.

Pamina’s exterior decor features lush greenery, ancient vines, fruit trees, and bare-stone, all of which convey the villa’s harmonious existence with its natural surroundings, a trend that continues throughout the interior. The terracotta flooring tiles, splashes of turquoise, wood furniture, and a natural-rock wall in one of the lounge areas all pay homage to Italy’s coast. Moving to the bedrooms, Pamina has two king-bed rooms, two queens, and two doubles. And, all of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms.

Pamina comes stocked with basic grocery items, and a maid visits daily to take care of the house, as well as make breakfast for the guests, which you can enjoy at the breakfast table, formal dining area, or at the alfresco set on the terrace. After breakfast, relax inside with television, Wi-Fi, and air conditioning. To beat the afternoon heat, hop in the refreshing swimming pool or find a shady spot on one the terrace living spaces and gaze upon the endless ocean view.

Lined with gorgeous beaches, dynamic cliffs and mountains, and beautiful cities, Italy’s Amalfi Coast is great for day trips. Sorrento and Amalfi Town are both about fifteen kilometers from Pamina. Head a little further, and you can visit Naples, a legendary city for art and architectural history. If you feel like sticking close to home, Positano Beach and the town square are just a twenty-minute walk. There, you’ll find shops, restaurants, nightlife, and beautiful beachfront.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Turan is a gorgeous luxury apartment in the Oltrarno neighborhood of Florence, with breathtaking views of the river Arno and Ponte Vecchio. An ideal vacation rental for two couples or a family, the villa features two ample bedroom suites with king beds and private bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, and lovely living and dining areas with high-end media features. The superb location in Oltrarno (literally "across the Arno") places you in the heart of authentic Florence, off the beaten tourist path, while still within easy walking distance of the Uffizi Gallery, Palazzo Pitti, and much more.

The design of Turan breathes modern style into the timeless elegance of Florence. Beautiful coffered ceilings extend above the open-concept living and dining room, evoking the building's antique origins. Soothing neutral tones in the walls and furnishings complement the beautiful parquet floors and rich wood bookshelves. Open the French windows to the river views as you sip your morning coffee or evening glasses of wine. Prepare delicious Tuscan feasts in the fully equipped kitchen, and gather around the beautiful dining table for six. The kitchen features superb contemporary appliances and beautiful white cabinetry, and serves an elegant modernist bar. Air conditioning and heating ensure comfort in all seasons.

The bedrooms are serene and beautifully furnished, with lovely touches of rich color in the fabric and artwork. Each features a king bed and access to a private bathroom with marble fixtures, offering a lovely private haven for afternoon siestas and peaceful nights.

Oltrarno has been dubbed "Florence's best kept secret" by the Wall Street Journal, a testament to its finely preserved character away from the crowds across the river. The neighborhood abounds in family-owned restaurants, charming bars, artisanal shops, and open-air markets selling local fare from the Tuscan countryside. And when it's time to explore the city's most vaunted treasures, you're just steps from the iconic Ponte Vecchio leading to the center.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Enjoy a Tuscan retreat that’s both quiet and secluded and convenient to the region’s cities at Villa Vianci. Originally built as a summer home where noble families could escape the heat, the restored seven-bedroom property offers an escape from the pressures of modern life without sacrificing modern conveniences. Located just off the highway between Florence and Siena outside the town of Staggia Senese, it’s in the center of Tuscany without being in the thick of things.

The elegant three-story home is approached through a gated courtyard and surrounded by vineyards and cypress groves. There’s a pool with outdoor shower as well as a charcoal barbecue, outdoor dining area and plenty of lounge chairs for sunbathing. Thanks to the recent restoration, the interiors are air-conditioned and have Wi-Fi access. The property’s caretakers live on the premises, making it easy to get assistance if needed.

The living areas of Villa Vianci prove that stately spaces can be comfortable, too. In the sitting rooms, terrazzo floors covered by Persian rugs, paneled walls and original moldings create an elegant envelope that’s filled by traditional-style wooden furniture and plush sofas pulled up to a fireplace. The formal dining room continues the theme with cool mint-green walls and antique sideboards. The kitchen, however, is fresh and modern, with white cabinets, black and white tile floors and marble countertops.

Each of the villa’s six bedrooms has air conditioning but is just as elegantly decorated as the property’s common spaces. There are five bedrooms with king or queen beds, each of which has its own ensuite bathroom. The remaining two bedrooms share a bathroom; one has two twin beds, and the other has two twin beds that can be converted into a queen bed.

Villa Vianci is set on a hilltop outside the ancient town of of Staggia Senese. From the villa, it’s just over a mile to the town’s church, restaurant, tennis court and grocery store. The Castellina Scalo train station is about 3 km away and the Colle Val d’Elsa golf course is 8 km away. There’s a beach 77 km away, and a ski area 137 away. The cities of Siena and Florence are 17 and 45 km away, respectively.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

Note: The caretakers live on the premises of the villa, in a portion of the third floor with independent entrance.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Chianti Fornace is an exquisite country villa in the Chianti region of central Tuscany. Situated in a secluded, rustic setting just five minutes from Tavarnelle Val di Pesa, the villa features beautiful, panoramic views of the surrounding hills and villages, extraordinary indoor and outdoor living and dining areas, and a deluxe private spa. With six superb bedrooms, this vacation rental is ideal for family reunions and momentous occasions in the heart of Tuscan wine country.

The gorgeously landscaped estate welcomes you with an enchanting pathway flanked by cypress trees, while lovely lemon and olive trees populate the gardens. Down a flight of stone steps from the villa's back entrance, the swimming pool terrace features elegant loungers and parasols on a smooth stone deck overlooking the countryside. Savor a delicious soak in the jetted hot tub and plunge into the pool for a morning swim. Kindle the stone barbeque grill and enjoy an alfresco meal in the dining pavilion, paired with local wine. Linger in the lounge as the children play on the charming swing set in the afternoon light.

Arched French doors open from the yard to a lovely living room, with wicker sofas, stone floors, exposed wood ceiling beams, and fireplace. Savor aperitivi by the fire, prepare classic Italian feasts in the stunning kitchen, and join each other around the six-person dining table beneath the gorgeous chandelier. After dinner, repair to the billiard room for a game of pool and a fine digestivo from the deluxe bar. In the morning, refresh your body in the private spa, with sauna, Jacuzzi, and steam bath.

The villa features four bedrooms in its main house—three with double size beds, one with two twins—all with walk-in closets and ensuite bathrooms of travertine marble. The guest house has two additional bedrooms—one with double bed, one with two twins—along with its own kitchen, dining area, and bathrooms.

Your location offers a supreme balance of seclusion and convenience. You're just five minutes from the enchanting medieval town of Tavarnelle Val di Pesa, while Florence, Radda, Siena, Gaiole, and San Gimignano are all within thirty to forty minutes—allowing for fantastic daytrips before returning to this private paradise.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This superb apartment is situated in the heart of Mayfair, in the West End of London, within walking distance or a short cab ride of Piccadilly Circus, Hyde Park, and the designer boutiques along Bond Street. The building was recently refurbished (ending in February 2018), which is reflected in the fresh, modern elegance of this private abode. Three bedrooms accommodate six guests in all, providing an ideal haven for families or groups of friends seeking stylish serenity and a prime location within this global capital of style and culture.

The apartment features a beautiful salon area for savoring time with loved-ones. Comfortable sofas and armchairs face the flat-screen 4K TV with satellite channels, illuminated by ceiling lights, exquisite lamps, and a triptych of windows. The open kitchen is fully equipped and serves a breakfast bar with plush-covered chairs, as well as a gorgeous dining room with vaulted, skylight ceilings over a table for six. The décor is understated yet exquisite, with lovely touches of naturalistic artwork, lush potted plants, and chevron-patterned parquet floors extending throughout the home. Heating, air conditioning, and underfloor heating in the bathrooms keep you comfortable in all seasons.

The master suite features a king bed accompanied by a TV, an exterior window, and a charming portal into the dining room, while its ensuite bathroom features a shower, tub, and dual vanity. Each of the two guest suites includes a double bed and ensuite bathroom, and one enjoys a pair of lovely French windows. Pendant lamps and beautiful pieces of original artwork frame each bed.

The apartment's coveted location places you within minutes of countless destinations in central London. Enjoy a shopping excursion on Bond Street; meander through Hyde Park; admire the masterpieces of the National Gallery; and take in a play in the Theater District.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

Put yourself into the perfect London pied-à-terre at Mayfair Two. Nestled into the heart of the Mayfair neighborhood, this bijou vacation rental is within walking distance of world-class shopping, dining, museums and more. Its one bedroom makes it just the right size for a couples getaway or a city honeymoon.

After a day of sightseeing, come back to a villa with all the amenities of home: a TV, air conditioning and heating to keep you comfortable no matter what the London weather, and laundry facilities to ensure you’re ready for the next day’s adventures. Wi-Fi access makes it easy to stay in touch with friends and family.

Mayfair Two’s bright, open-concept living and dining room takes its inspiration from the days of mod London, with a jewel-toned sofa and dining chairs, sleek accent tables and a plush beni ourain–style area rug. The separate kitchen has a practical galley layout and is fully equipped, with high-contrast white cabinets and glossy dark countertops.

The villa’s single bedroom has a king bed, TV and en-suite bathroom. It’s a hotel-worthy private retreat with serene silver-toned carpet and wallpaper, floor-length drapes, built-in storage and subtly mid-century-inspired nightstands. Plenty of stone tile gives the bathroom a vibe of spa-like luxury.

You could easily spend a holiday exploring the shops and restaurants of this part of Mayfair. Hunt down one-of-a-kind finds at the Dover Street Market, or browse the boutiques on New Bond Street, Oxford Street and Regent Street. The apartment is less than a 15-minute walk from iconic London destinations such as Hyde Park and Piccadilly Circus and, for royal fans, it’s less than a 20-minute drive to Kensington Palace and Buckingham Palace. It’s also less than half an hour by taxi—or Tube—to must-sees such as Westminster Abbey, Big Ben and the London Eye.

listing.listing_description:
Scudo is a fashionable luxury property set in an exclusive location in the heart of Florence! On the third floor of a historical Florentine palazzo with an elevator, Scudo has been completely transformed into a calming and serene urban oasis. And while Scudo is an elegant and very sophisticated apartment, you will feel both welcome and exceptionally comfortable. Get the holiday you deserve!

Kick back in this most sophisticated area of Tuscany. This vacation rental features a sauna, so you can get into that sweet relaxed mood any time of day. Other perks at this private apartment include satellite television and Wi-Fi. For an extra cost, you can also receive cooking, housekeeping and babysitting services, as well as villa pre-stocking and airport transfers. Just ask our dedicated concierge so you can hit your vacation running!

This exquisite four-bedroom apartment boasts traditional architecture that dates back to the 1600s. A clever monochromatic palette unifies the entire space including the minimalistic furnishings with clean lines. Lounge around in the living area with an eye for retro-inspired design. The stylish formal dining area includes seating for eight and lies adjacent the fully equipped gourmet kitchen.

Four magnificent bedrooms accommodate up to eight guests at this non-smoking apartment. Three bedrooms offer en-suite bathrooms. The fourth bedroom will enjoy access to the hall bathroom with a jetted tub. The master suite offers a king bed, a fireplace and a lounge. All of the sleeping quarters provide air conditioning.

Scudo makes a great bet for a family holiday or a decadent honeymoon in Italy. You will be situated in lovely downtown Florence and within walking distance of Piazza del Duomo. The famous towns of Montalcino, Montepulciano and Pienza are all within easy driving distance and well worth a visit. As you will soon find out, Tuscan cuisine is itself quite simple, focusing on natural flavors – and perhaps therein lies some part of the secret to what Italians call la dolce vita, or living ‘the sweet life.’ Book your stay today with Luxury Retreats!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Why compromise on your vacation? Villa Marchesa is a modern mansion with traditional style, a secluded country estate that’s still close to town. Nestled into private woodlands on the Maremma coast of Tuscany, the nine-bedroom property is near both beaches and cities. Larger groups can rent its sister villa, located on the same estate.

The villa’s centerpiece is its three pools, linked by waterfalls and adjoined by a pool house. After a swim or a day of sightseeing, relax in the sauna and jetted tub and sip an aperitif at the al fresco dining area. The villa itself is both air conditioned and heated and is equipped with high-speed Internet and a printer. Fitness buffs will appreciate the gym; others can enjoy some low-key games in the billiards room.

Inspired by historic Tuscan country houses, Villa Marchesa’s interiors are rustic yet sophisticated. Light stone floors, brick arches and pale-wood beamed ceilings put a modern spin on farmhouse architecture, and purple and fuchsia upholstery and accents are an unexpected touch. Instead of the traditional fireplace, there’s a hearth surrounded by seating. Multiple seating and dining areas and a quiet study ensure there’s space to spread out, and the fully equipped eat-in kitchen has two gas ranges.

Each of the property’s nine bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom, air conditioning and Internet access. There’s one bedroom with a king bed, one bedroom with a double bed, two bedrooms with queen beds, and four bedrooms with two twin beds each. The ninth bedroom is in a more private annex and has two twin beds.

Villa Marchesa is just over 2 miles from the nearest town and a 20-minute drive from the regional center of Grosseto. If you’re after sun and sand, the beaches of Scarlino and Punta Ala are 30 minutes by car; if art and architecture are more your speed, drive to Siena, 40 minutes away, or Florence, 90 minutes away. The nearest airport is in Pisa, about 100 minutes away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Steal away to a sunny retreat with a secret garden in the heart of London at Pembroke. Set in an elegant townhouse in the city’s fashionable Kensington area, this charming vacation rental is bright and vintage-inspired, and opens to a lovely private outdoor space. Use its three bedrooms for a sightseeing holiday with family, a getaway with other couples or even a city honeymoon.

On warmer mornings, bring your coffee out to the house’s walled terrace to sip; on sunny afternoons, relax with a glass of wine in the al-fresco sitting area. In cooler weather, a TV, sound system and Wi-Fi inside make it easy to relax after a busy day exploring London.

Pembroke opens to an inviting living area that stretches the full length of the house, with a living room at the front featuring built-in bookcases, a fireplace and a window seat overlooking the front garden, and a conservatory at the back that opens to stairs into the garden. Downstairs, the fully equipped kitchen has a breakfast bar and gorgeous cabinetry in a deep blue. It’s adjacent to a TV lounge and a dining room that also has garden access.

This luxury residence has three bedrooms with double beds: one with an en-suite bathroom and two that share a bathroom. Like the rest of the house, the bedrooms are bright and spacious, with pretty, traditional details such as built-in cabinets, paneled walls and floor-length drapes.

The villa’s prime Kensington location means it’s less than a 10-minute drive from attractions such as Harrods and Hyde Park, and less than a 20-minute drive from Westminster Abbey and Buckingham Palace. It’s well worth traveling a bit farther to see the splendor of St. Paul’s Cathedral, delve into British history at the Tower of London or peek behind the scenes of the Harry Potter films on the Warner Brothers studio tour.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This fabulous luxury townhouse is located within steps of Earl's Court in the Kensington neighborhood of London. The renovated Victorian home with redbrick facade blends antique elegance, exceptional modern comforts, and beautiful contemporary artwork. Spacious interior living areas, a gourmet kitchen, and an ample alfresco terrace form an ideal haven for private enjoyments between excursions on the city. Three comfortable bedrooms accommodate families, business travelers, or groups of friends up to six in size.

The apartment's central, open-concept living area offers ample room for serene downtime or festive gatherings, with large windows infusing the space with plentiful natural daylight. Enjoy cozy evenings in the lounge by the fire, watching your favorite TV programs or sharing a bottle of wine. Prepare delicious meals in the sleek, fully equipped kitchen, and gather around the beautiful table for six. Smooth hardwood floors and uncluttered white surfaces conjure a natural tranquility, accentuating the gallery-worthy artwork and subtle touches of exquisite décor.

A lovely conservatory is located off the master bedroom, with skylight windows illuminating a quiet sitting area. This room leads through French doors to the private back terrace, featuring an open-air lounge area and table—perfect for meals and spirits under the summer sky.

The master suite features a king bed, desk, TV, and deluxe ensuite bathroom with shower and freestanding tub. Each of the two guestrooms has a queen bed. One has access to a hallway bathroom, while the other enjoys an ensuite bathroom with shower. Heating throughout the home keeps you comfortable in the winter months.

The vintage townhouse is within easy walking distance of Earl's Court and a plethora of fine restaurants, classic pubs, boutique stores, and Peter Jones. Explore other London neighborhoods via the Earl's Court Tube station, or drive minutes to nearby attractions including Harrods, Kensington Palace, and the V&A Museum.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Steep yourself in the cosmopolitan artistry of Bloomsbury at this 3-floor penthouse near Russell Square. A visionary architectural achievement, the home features 3 king suites and diverse living areas on all levels—including 2 terraces with alfresco dining—set amid a veritable museum of original artwork. The prime location is an easy walk from the British Museum, Oxford Circus, and myriad nightspots.

On the main level, the gourmet kitchen with wet bar serves an interior dining table for 6 and ample lounge. Evocative features including a transparent ceiling, floating glass staircase, modernist dining stools, and natural wood floors create an ambiance of airy luminosity. A wide threshold opens to the lower terrace, featuring an outdoor dining table perched beside an impressive wall painting.

Upstairs, skylight windows illuminate another lounge area and office space. A few steps lead up to the upper terrace, with yet another dining table and views of the Bloomsbury rooftops.

The master suite includes a king bed, private patio, and deluxe ensuite bathroom with jetted hot tub and shower. The two guestrooms also have king beds and ensuite bathrooms, one of which includes an antique stand-alone tub. Each bedroom has its own character and unique collection of artwork. Throughout the penthouse, heating and air conditioning ensure comfort at all times.

Bloomsbury and the surrounding neighborhoods offer an extraordinary combination of literary history and culture, world-class museums and galleries, independent shops, and excellent historic pubs. Enjoy mornings in Bedford or Russell Squares, stroll down Lamb's Conduit Street, and take in the masterpieces at the British Museum or National Gallery. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Set on a hilltop in Chianti, villa Le Pratola offers views in every direction and something for every member of the family. Kids will love the pool and games room, while adults will appreciate the proximity to Siena and Florence. Five air-conditioned bedroom suites and nearly five acres of gardens mean there’s room for everyone to spread out.

The villa is well-equipped for exploring or relaxing. Take a swim in the infinity pool, go head-to-head in the games room or at the pool table and work up a sweat in the compact gym. There’s a wood-burning outdoor barbecue, and a dining area in the stone courtyard where you can enjoy what you’ve grilled. Relax on loungers around the pool or take advantage of the Wi-Fi access indoors.

Le Pratola’s stone walls and beamed ceilings are a traditional envelope for striking modern interiors. In the living room, a sleek sectional is pulled up to an original fireplace surround, and a red Lucite coffee table and striped chair add fun, glamorous touches. The dining room is open and airy, with a large arched window, and the state-of-the-art kitchen pairs stone countertops with glossy red cabinets.

Each of the villa’s five air-conditioned bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom stocked with a hairdryer and toiletries. There are three bedrooms with queen beds, the master with a super king size bed and one of which also has a sofa bed. The fifth bedroom has two twin beds as well as a trundle bed. The villa has five bedrooms overall: Four bedrooms on the top floor, with an additional bedroom on the ground floor, located across the courtyard with a private entrance. For the smallest guests, baby equipment like a crib, highchair and booster seat is available.

Though Le Pratola offers the peace and panoramas of a location in rural Chianti, it’s just over a mile from the Pozze di Lecchi restaurant, and about 2 miles from a grocery store, church and town center. You’ll find a train station and the Siena hospital 9 miles away, and it’s a 2-hour drive to the airport.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Live out a historic Italian fantasy in the luxurious, newly renovated Villa Palazzo. From its romantic stucco exterior, medieval stone tower and 13th-century chapel and crypt to its traditionally furnished interiors and on-site staff, there’s plenty to inspire and pamper. Located less than an hour from Florence, Pisa and Siena, the six bedroom property makes the perfect base from which to explore Tuscany.

The villa’s manicured lawn and garden commands a view of the countryside as far as the famed skyline of San Gimignano. Enjoy dinner fresh from the outdoor grill on the covered terrace, and descend a staircase to the pool, which has its own loggia with a shower and fridge. Explore the 13th century chapel dedicated to Saint Bartholomew or the Internet via the house’s Wi-Fi.

True to its name, Villa Palazzo offers elegant, magazine worthy interiors. In the living room, historic touches like beamed ceilings, terracotta floors, carved fireplaces and damask chairs are paired with modern tuxedo sofas, all watched over by Renaissance style portraits. Sit down in the formal dining room, which has its own fireplace, or take your espresso in the more casual breakfast area adjoining the fully equipped modern white kitchen.

There are five bedrooms in the main villa and one in the tower annex, each with its own character. In the main house, you’ll find two bedrooms with queen beds, one with an en-suite bathroom and one with a private bathroom, jetted tub and balcony. There are two bedrooms with two twin beds and private bathrooms. The fifth bedroom has two twin beds, combined to form a queen, as well as an en-suite bathroom with jetted tub. Climb the medieval tower to find a bedroom with a queen bed, en-suite bathroom, fireplace, sitting area and its own rooftop terrace.

Villa Palazzo is about 2 miles outside the town of Castelfiorentino, which offers shopping, dining and a tennis court. Bring your clubs for a round at the Castelfalfi golf course, about 12 miles away. The sights of Florence, Siena and Pisa are each less than an hour away, and when it’s time to leave, it’s only 19 miles to the Florence airport and 28 miles to the Pisa airport.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
With accommodations for seven in downtown Chelsea, the fashion district, it doesn’t get any easier to explore the many wonders of Central London. Big Ben, Hyde Park, Buckingham Palace, Piccadilly Circus, and so many more world famous attractions are located within twenty-minutes drive. And, when it comes to culture, nightlife, fine dining, and shopping, you won’t have any trouble finding something new and exciting in Chelsea, there’s plenty to see within a short walk from Prince Luxe.

This purple pastel townhouse is located just off King’s Road in the middle of an adorable line of houses that showcase Chelsea’s stylish and cheerful way of life. Once inside, you’ll love the modern-elegant ambiance created by a soft color scheme, contemporary furniture, and sleek, high-end electronics, appliances, and fixtures. The kitchen is beautifully designed, with integrated appliances and plenty of functional workspaces.

Prince Luxe comes with a fully equipped kitchen and offers two great spaces for dining in. First, the elegant dining room, with a mirrored accent wall and seating for six, it is perfect for formal occasions. The second option is the alfresco set on the rooftop patio; it’s a great spot to drink your morning coffee and plan out another exciting day in London.

Enjoying a laidback brunch is a favorite pastime of Chelsea residents, and places like Bluebird, Tom’s Kitchen, and Eelbrook are among the most popular spots. After brunch, you could check out Stamford Bridge, the stadium where Chelsea FC play, you’ll see their fans and colors just about everywhere in Chelsea. Just off Sloane Square, the Saatchi Gallery is an incredible contemporary art museum housed in an old military building from the turn of the eighteenth-century. At dinner, Gordon Ramsay’s three-Michelin starred restaurant is nearby on Royal Hospital Road. And, you’ll want to check out local pubs like Chelsea Potter and McGettigan’s, or popular dance clubs Raffles and JuJu for some late night fun.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Tucked away on one of the rolling hillsides of Corfu, this luxurious Greek vacation home is waiting to host your next amazing family getaway, couples retreat, or romantic honeymoon. With amazing views of the lush, tree-covered hillside, the olive groves and valley below, and the bright turquoise Sea in the distance, Rana’s atmosphere is immediately relaxing. The villa features three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and housekeeping.

A relaxing, elegant color scheme is used throughout the villa, making use of pure whites and light-toned woods to create a tranquil environment. Each bedroom features a colorful accent wall to add character and individuality to each space. The living room, dining area, and kitchen are all part of a free-flowing open-concept layout, perfect for uniting the whole group. The living room features wide openings to the terrace, ensuring the villa is naturally ventilated with fresh ocean breeze and sunlight.

Villa Rana’s fully equipped kitchen comes with state of the art appliances, functional counter space, a coffee machine, and there’s a formal dining area. Inside, you’ll find television, Wi-Fi, and air conditioning. On the terrace, you’ll love cooling off in the swimming pool and relaxing in the hot tub. There is also an alfresco dining set if you’d rather dine under the stars. And of course, a beautiful scenic view of the Sea and rolling hillside.

One of the best places in town to have dinner is Taverna Agni. This family-owned beachfront restaurant has rave reviews, a serene atmosphere, and incredible food. While you’re out, visit the downtown area of Corfu for shopping, dining, and their famed Archaeological Museum.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
If you’re after a Tuscan vacation with historic ambience, look no further than Buonvisi. Built in the 16th century and recently restored, the villa is rich in both original details and 21st-century touches like a pool and Wi-Fi. Its location on the Fattoria Mansi Bernardini estate gives guests access to resort-like amenities such as a restaurant and shared tennis court.

The stately house and its piano nobile overlook a wide, flat lawn and inground pool. Serve dinner hot off the outdoor grill at the al fresco dining area, or ask the estate staff to prepare a local favorite. In the summer, stroll the grounds, rest in the mature trees’ shade or bring your racquet to the shared tennis court; in the winter, cozy up to one of several fireplaces.

The villa’s charm lies in its mix of preserved original features, like ornate fireplaces, beamed ceilings and moldings, and comfortable modern furnishings. Gather the whole family in one of several seating areas in the spacious living room, or retreat to a seat by the fire in the snug library. The roomy kitchen also has a fireplace and traditional indoor barbecue, plus more modern features like a microwave, coffee machine and dishwasher.

Buonvisi’s eight bedrooms are spread across its two floors. On the ground floor, a double bedroom with en-suite bathroom offers a more private space. Upstairs, there are four bedrooms with double beds, and three with two twin beds each. All have en-suite bathrooms, and the same architectural charm as the common areas—think beamed ceilings and tiled floors.

The estate is just 2 km from the shops and post office in the town of Segromigno in Monte, and less than 12 km from the Renaissance architecture in the city of Lucca. It’s also less than 45 km to the resort town of Forte dei Marmi and its renowned beaches. If you’d like to explore more of Italy, Pisa’s airport is about 37 km away, and Florence is just under 60 km.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: HEATING - Heating is available at an additional charge of 50 Euro per day and must be paid directly on the spot to the owner or his/her representative before departing. Please note that heating in Italy, when not subject to restrictions by the local Government, is more expensive compared to other countries. If you look for a property in low season, make sure to ask for an estimate of the heating cost. You may be asked a supplementary deposit for heating expenses.

WATER AND ELECTRICITY - Please note that most of the properties that we offer are not the typical purpose-built Mediterranean holiday villas. Most are converted farmhouses or former manor houses, full of character and history. Water shortages do occur; please use it sparingly during the summer months. At the same time, Italy is probably one of the few countries in the world where the government has introduced a system of electricity limitators to contain the national consumption. This means you must be careful when using more than one appliance at once because the limitator will shut the electricity off.

listing.listing_description:
Rolling hills, a fairy-tale stone house and rustic-chic interiors: you’ll find it all at Villa Federico. Tucked into the countryside outside Siena, this luxury vacation rental in Tuscany will quickly entrance you with its idyllic setting and beautiful indoor and outdoor living areas. It’s the perfect rural Italian escape for an unforgettable holiday with friends or family.

Weekdays at Villa Federico begin with complimentary breakfast service, after which you can nestle into the study with a book or step outside to claim a lounge chair by the pool. As the sun sinks toward the hills, heat up the barbecue and linger into the evening over a bottle of local wine at the al-fresco dining area.

The villa’s interiors combine the charm of the past with the comforts of the present. High ceilings, terracotta floors and plenty of French doors with landscape views set a traditional tone that’s matched by a roll-arm sofa and bergere chairs around an open-hearth fireplace in the living room, and a farmhouse-style table with slipcovered seating for six in the dining room. The incredible kitchen is fully equipped and even has a wood-burning stove and doors out to the patio.

Villa Federico’s seven bedrooms are divided between the five-bedroom main house and two one-bedroom annexes. The main house has two bedrooms with queen beds, two with twin beds and one with a French bed; all have en-suite bathrooms and several have jetted tubs as well. Each annex has a queen bed (or two twin beds), en-suite bathroom and kitchenette, and one has its own jetted tub. With their separate, private entrances, the annexes could be used as honeymoon suites or in-law retreats.

The best way to see Tuscany is to set off into the rolling hills on foot or on a bicycle. The property is just a short drive from the town of San Casciano dei Bagni, where you’ll find shops, local restaurants and cafes, and a legendary thermal spa that’s been soothing visitors for centuries. If you’d like to explore further, the towns of Cetona and Orvieto are close enough for a day trip.

feature.strong: What to do in the San Casciano dei Bagni region of Tuscany?
feature.p: Take a visit to the renowned thermal spa in San Casciano dei Bagni. It was the Etruscans who first discovered the healing properties of the thermal waters in Val d'Orcia. In the 17th century, the renowned Medici family built a series of baths, which have been reborn as a luxurious new spa featured in Travel & Leisure.

The enchanting town of Cetona will charm you with its cobblestone streets and medieval architecture. This lovely village has grown in popularity as a home for international artists and socialites. Stop for an exquisite lunch or dinner at Osteria Vecchia (so good!)—you won't be disappointed.
Definitely worth a visit are Orvieto, Assisi and Todi. Head to Deruta to shop for the renowned local ceramics. Last but not least, make sure to check out the chocolate museum in Perugia!

listing.listing_description:
Standing majestically in a beautiful parkland, Villa Lenka is an aristocratic 17th century villa offering the discerning traveler Tuscan living at its finest. The villa is nestled amid tranquil Italian gardens through which flows a fresh water brook into two small lakes overlooked by a shady weeping willow tree. Discover the magical beauty of Villa Lenka and enjoy inspired moments of harmony, relaxation and refinement this year in Tuscany!

The grand cypress trees and fragrant lemon and herb gardens create the perfect backdrop to the private swimming pool. Amid water features, ponds and a lush garden, alfresco dining is a pure delight. Or maybe you are in the mood to just curl up underneath the shade of the enchanting gazebo entwined in vines – which is also a special spot for a romantic moment or an inspiring toast! Among its countless features, the villa offers a wine cellar, a wood burning oven in the cellar, satellite television, DVD player and Wi-Fi. You will also find various games and a library. Your reservation includes a full staff with complimentary chef service and housekeeping.

The large and spacious frescoed rooms filled with antique furnishings offer an air of elegance throughout, as modern conveniences blend beautifully with the rich heritage of this ancient family home. Charm and character abound throughout grand reception rooms a magnificent drawing room, a cozy television lounge, a card room, a Tuscan kitchen, a breakfast room and a lovely dining room. Overall, the villa has been decorated and furnished with an eye to the classic.

The seven luxurious bedrooms accommodate up to fourteen guests in a sublimely sophisticated ambience. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning and heating. The master bedroom includes a king size bed, and you will find either queens or twins in the other guest suites. Fine linens and accoutrements offer splendid nights of rest.

Built in 1624, Villa Lenka is set in a verdant valley in the southern hills of Lucca and was once summer residence to Count Cosimo Bernardini. The Bernardini family owned several palazzo’s in the city center as well as many villas in the surrounding hills. Come experience the opulence, history, culture and cuisine that have put Tuscany on the international map as one of the most coveted holiday areas in Europe!

listing.listing_description:
If you’ve come to Italy for the views, look no further than Villa Alfieri. The restored stone country house has gorgeous views of the Tuscan countryside and medieval city of Siena, and plenty of outdoor space from which to admire them, from a shaded pergola to a lawn around the pool. Inside, magazine-worthy decor creates a refined yet comfortable ambience.

The U-shaped villa surrounds a central courtyard, but the manicured garden beyond also beckons. Start the day with an espresso under the pergola, then move to the pool to take a dip or just relax on a lounger and listen to the waterfall. End with a glass of wine on the second-floor loggia and a movie via satellite television or Wi-Fi; there’s even air conditioning to keep you comfortable all night.

The interiors combine striking contemporary design, like the sleek white stucco fireplace in the spacious living, with the best of classic Tuscan style, like stone walls and vaulted brick ceilings in one of the two dining rooms. The fully equipped kitchen pairs the rustic charm of beamed ceilings and sage green accents with modern touches like stone countertops.

Each of Villa Alfieri's five airy bedrooms has its own marble bathroom. The master suite has a king bed and two bathrooms: one with shower and one with tub. Two more bedrooms also have king beds and en-suite bathrooms; one has a walk-in closet as well. The remaining two bedrooms each have a queen bed, and one has an en-suite bathroom while the other has a private bathroom. For families traveling with children, an additional bedroom can be set up with two twin beds and a shared bathroom.

A daily continental breakfast is included in the rental, but if you’re curious about regional specialties, you can request a dinner prepared by a local cook. Work off the Tuscan cuisine at the tennis court, a 15 minute drive away, or the golf course and riding stables, a 30 minute drive away. Explore the gardens of the Villa di Geggiano, the estate to which Villa Alfieri once belonged, and don’t miss a nearby 14th century convent. Plus, Siena is just 9.6 km away by car, and the Florence airport only 88.5 km away.

feature.p: At Extra Cost – advance notice may be required:

Villa Alfieri has been featured in famous Italian interior design magazines such as Casa Vogue, Case di Campagna, and La Cascina Toscana. Its spectacular views are among the best in the region. Among the great services Villa Alfieri has to offer, guests can enjoy typical Tuscan cuisine prepared by a local cook. Due to its location Villa Alfieri is blessed with a breeze from the north, and the house is cool because of its stone construction.

Villa Alfieri once belonged to a larger estate: the splendid Villa di Geggiano which sits nearby. Renowned for its elegance, Villa di Geggiano is not normally open to the public, but don't miss a visit to its spectacular gardens. Also very close by is the majestic Certosa di Pontignano, a convent dating back to 1343. The architecture is organized around three cloisters, which differ in size and period. The first, Certosa, is characterized by a simply worked but beautiful stone well. The related church, decorated with paintings by Poccetti and Francesco Vanni, is open to the public on Sundays. The middle cloister, constructed of brick and housing 17th century frescoes, is the largest and most impressive of all.
feature.strong: What to do in the Siena region of Tuscany?
feature.p: The medieval town of Siena was founded by the Etruscans and later became a Roman colony. During the 13th and 14th centuries it flourished as one of the major cities of Europe, growing rich from banking and the wool trade. The 14th century saw a great amount of construction: the Duomo, the Palazzo Publico and the Campo Square were all products of this time. Siena's glory took a tragic downturn by the end of the 14th century due to the Black Death and political upheaval. The city became little more than a rural market center. It was exactly this decline that accounts for the incredible state of medieval preservation that Siena exhibits today. Built across several hills and valleys, you will find a bit of up and down while walking through the historical center. However, the lack of traffic makes it a wonderful place to stroll—even when packed with tourists, there is a quiet and easygoing feel. A must-see is the shell-shaped square called Il Campo. This is the focal point of the city as well as being the venue for the internationally renowned horse race, the Palio.

Casole d'Elsa hosts one of the most charming museums of the many recently opened/restyled in Siena. The art exhibited ranges from the Neolithic era to the XVII century. A visit to the attached Collegiata di Casole is also highly recommended.

Colle Val d'Elsa's newer outskirts offer very few attractions, aside from the crystal manufacturing—but the old town/historical center, Colle Alta, deserves to be seen. Particularly interesting in Colle Alta is the Palazzo Campana, built in the XVI century by the architect Agnolo di Baccio d'Agnolo. This private building looks like a city gate, or a triumphal arch, and dominates the main street of Colle. The Cathedral shows a rich collection of paintings from the XVII century. Don't miss the dramatic and intense Nativity by Rutilio Manetti (fourth chapel on the right, looking to the main altar).

listing.listing_description:
Spend an exceptional stay in London at Two Jermyn Street. Beautifully appointed and centrally located, this two-bedroom apartment is a haven of luxury in the heart of the city, close to museums, palaces, shopping and more. Reserve its spacious rooms for a holiday with family, a weekend away with another couple or a honeymoon-style escape with your sweetheart.

After a day out in the city, pour a glass of wine and look out over the rooftops from the private balcony on the fifth floor, see what’s showing on the satellite TV or share photos via Wi-Fi. For your convenience, the villa also has an espresso machine and laundry facilities.

Two Jermyn Street is laid out around an open-concept living and dining area, where an ornate fireplace lends traditional charm and metallic accents add contemporary glam. The neutral-toned sectional and dining table for six are comfortable and inviting, and the separate galley kitchen is fully equipped.

Each of the two bedrooms at this vacation rental has a queen bed, en-suite bathroom and air conditioning; one of the bedrooms also opens to the balcony. For larger parties or families traveling with older children who might want their own accommodations, there’s also a double sofa bed in the living room.

A stay at Two Jermyn Street puts you just minutes from the city’s top sights. Its St. James location is a 4-minute walk from Piccadilly Circus and less than a 10-minute drive from Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Harrods and Hyde Park. Listen to Big Ben chime the hours, marvel at the hush inside Westminster Abbey and shop for souvenirs or step out for dinner in the streets around the apartment. Or take it all in from a bird’s-eye viewpoint on a ride on the nearby London Eye.

listing.listing_description:
Even though the walk to town only takes a minute, you still deserve a reward. So, wander the streets of Gordes until you find the perfect cafe to sit down for your morning coffee and a croissant that’s still warm from the oven. Before returning to your 17th-century hillside-home, stop in at a local market, bakery, or cheese shop to pick up an afternoon snack to enjoy on Sunset Villa’s valley-view terrace.

Widely considered “the most beautiful hilltop village in Provence,” Gordes is steeped in authenticity. The white and gray stone buildings, of which Sunset is interwoven, wind their way up the hill, creating one of the most postcard-worthy views in France. Exposed beams, rugged stone, and wood furniture complete the elegant, Old-World atmosphere inside. Outside, lush greenery from the garden climbs the stonewalls of the terrace providing shade for afternoon naps and privacy during alfresco dinners.

When you’re not out exploring Gordes, Villa Sunset’s spacious layout is perfect for nights in with friends and family. Smart TV, a Sonos sound system, Wi-Fi, and air conditioning will make sure your party is cool and connected. After a formal dinner, unwind with a cocktail or a pop open a bottle of wine from a local vineyard. Then, watch the sunset as you splash around in the swimming pool.

The architecturally astounding village of Gordes is a photographers dream and a vacation destination all its own. However, this beautiful setting may inspire you to keep exploring. Luckily, the bustling city of Avignon and the canals of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorge are within a few kilometers. And, if you’re looking to sneak away for an afternoon on the golf course, Provence Country Club’s eighteen-hole is a great way to enjoy the dynamic views of the French countryside.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Escape the city whenever you please at this chic apartment above the bustling streets of central London. Plan out a day of sightseeing while you sip your morning tea in the furnished terrace lounge. Then, grab a quick bite and look out over the city-view before you head downstairs. Once you’re on the streets, walk the Marylebone neighborhood to discover boutique shops, cafes, and historic pubs.

Just like the streets below, The Water Lily sparks curiosity with its trendy, artistic atmosphere. Take a moment to inspect the artifacts in the glass display case beside the living room’s piano. Have the entertainer in your group play a few numbers while you check out the view through the antique telescope. On a quiet night in, curl up in the media room for a movie. Or, find peace and tranquility in the yoga studio.

Throw on some comfortable shoes and walk to nearby neighborhoods, Soho, Oxford Circus, and Mayfair, where you’ll effortlessly stumble upon unique shops, brilliant bakeries, and bustling local pubs. The big attractions, like Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, and Covent Garden, are all under 3-miles in a taxi. Before dinner, do some shopping in Picadilly Circus, and take a quick stroll through some of the free art museums in the area. Then, see what stirs your appetite at Camden Market.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
